lancityMcnsMib.name: lancityMcnsMib
lancityMcnsMib.contactinfo: Dale Hokanson Postal: Bay Networks Broadband Technologies Division 200 Bulfinch Drive Andover, MA 01810 U.S.A. Phone: +1 978 682 1600 E-mail: support@lancity.com
lancityMcnsMib.description: This is the portion of the Lancity enterprise MIB that applies to MCNS cable modems and related devices.

lcCmtsUpstreamTable.name: lcCmtsUpstreamTable
lcCmtsUpstreamTable.description: Defines properties of upstream channels, from the CMTS.

lcCmtsUpstreamEntry.name: lcCmtsUpstreamEntry
lcCmtsUpstreamEntry.description: Defines properties of an upstream channel, from the CMTS.

lcCmtsUpMinimumMapSize.name: lcCmtsUpMinimumMapSize
lcCmtsUpMinimumMapSize.description: Minimum number of slots to be mapped in each Map PDU.

lcCmtsUpMaximumMapSize.name: lcCmtsUpMaximumMapSize
lcCmtsUpMaximumMapSize.description: Maximum number of slots to be mapped in each Map PDU.

lcCmtsUpContentionPerMap.name: lcCmtsUpContentionPerMap
lcCmtsUpContentionPerMap.description: The number of mini-slots allotted to contention (REQ or REQ-DATA) per MAP PDU.

lcCmtsUpRequestDataAllowed.name: lcCmtsUpRequestDataAllowed
lcCmtsUpRequestDataAllowed.description: Specifies whether or not the CMTS will allow contention data on this upstream interface.

lcCmtsUpMaxDataInContention.name: lcCmtsUpMaxDataInContention
lcCmtsUpMaxDataInContention.description: The number of mini-slots that may be used for a single upstream contention transmission.

lcCmtsUpInitialRangingInterval.name: lcCmtsUpInitialRangingInterval
lcCmtsUpInitialRangingInterval.description: The duration, in microseconds, of the initial ranging interval. This interval is used by unranged modems to enter the network, and so must be long enough to admit the most distant modem.

lcCmtsUpHighPriorityThreshold.name: lcCmtsUpHighPriorityThreshold
lcCmtsUpHighPriorityThreshold.description: Weighting of high priority queue is-a-vis normal priority queue.

lcCmtsUpGuaranteedThreshold.name: lcCmtsUpGuaranteedThreshold
lcCmtsUpGuaranteedThreshold.description: Permitted aggregate CIR, as a percentage of the overall channel bandwidth.

lcCmtsUpPublicationDelay.name: lcCmtsUpPublicationDelay
lcCmtsUpPublicationDelay.description: A sum of architectural constants, parameters, and network status (RTD) that governs the difference between the publication time of the MAP and its effectiveness.

lcCmtsUpNFlowControlledMaps.name: lcCmtsUpNFlowControlledMaps
lcCmtsUpNFlowControlledMaps.description: The number of Map PDUs that were generated under flow-controlled (prioritized) conditions.

lcCmtsUpNNonFlowControlledMaps.name: lcCmtsUpNNonFlowControlledMaps
lcCmtsUpNNonFlowControlledMaps.description: The number of Map PDUs that were generated under FIFO conditions.

lcCmtsUpChannelPower.name: lcCmtsUpChannelPower
lcCmtsUpChannelPower.description: The CMTS receiver input power level, which is the nominal receive power level for upstream data. This value will be automatically scaled by the CMTS if the channel's width is changed.

lcCmtsUpInputPowerWindow.name: lcCmtsUpInputPowerWindow
lcCmtsUpInputPowerWindow.description: The CMTS receiver input power window (+/- tenths dB) at which a CM is allowed to operated in. This value has the range of 20 -150 tenths of dB which represents windows +/- 2 dB to a window of +/- 15 dB. The theoretical upper limit of this range is 9 dB.

lcCmtsCurrentTemp.name: lcCmtsCurrentTemp
lcCmtsCurrentTemp.description: Current temperature of a CMTS device in degrees Celsius.

lcCmtsHighTempThreshold.name: lcCmtsHighTempThreshold
lcCmtsHighTempThreshold.description: High temperature threshold limit of a CMTS device in degrees Celsius, above which an event occurs to signal that the threshold has been exceeded. The device temperature is read once per minute and compared to this threshold value. A trap is sent out if the event's priority indicates that a trap is to be sent (refer to the docsDevEvControlTable object in DOCS-CABLE-DEVICE-MIB). The priority of this event is critical(3).

lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceEnableTabl.name: lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceEnableTable
lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceEnableTabl.description: Defines which upstreams are enabling this feature and which metrics to use.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnableEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnableEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnableEntry.description: Defines which upstreams are enabling this feature and which metrics to use.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceEnable.description: Enable Ingress Avoidance for the Upstream.

lcCmtsMetric1Enable.name: lcCmtsMetric1Enable
lcCmtsMetric1Enable.description: Enable the metric associated with Ingress Avoidance.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigTab.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigTab.description: Defines the provisioned frequencies per carrier path.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigEnt.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFrequencyConfigEnt.description: Defines which upstreams are enabling this feature and which metrics to use.

lcCmtsCarrierPathIndex.name: lcCmtsCarrierPathIndex
lcCmtsCarrierPathIndex.description: Carrier path index for the frequency ranges.

lcCmtsFreqConfigIndex.name: lcCmtsFreqConfigIndex
lcCmtsFreqConfigIndex.description: Index for frequency ranges for each carrier path.

lcCmtsFreqAvailable.name: lcCmtsFreqAvailable
lcCmtsFreqAvailable.description: Allow frequency range to be used for the carrier path.

lcCmtsStartFrequency.name: lcCmtsStartFrequency
lcCmtsStartFrequency.description: Beginning frequency in the frequency range (Hz). Range must be within the 5-42 MHz range and start must be less than or equal to stop frequency.

lcCmtsStopFrequency.name: lcCmtsStopFrequency
lcCmtsStopFrequency.description: End frequency in the frequency range (Hz). Range must be within the 5-42 MHz range and start must be less than or equal to stop frequency.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefTable.description: Defines carrier paths (Physical Connectivity) and channel groups for each upstream.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceChangePrefEntry.description: Defines carrier paths (Physical Connectivity) and channel groups for each upstream.

lcCmtsChangePreference.name: lcCmtsChangePreference
lcCmtsChangePreference.description: Defines which type of change is the prefered change if ingress avoidance detects a problem in the current configuration.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdTable.description: Defines threshold for each of the ingress avoidance available metrics.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceThresholdEntry.description: Defines threshold for each of the ingress avoidance available metrics.

lcCmtsMetric1GreenToYellow.name: lcCmtsMetric1GreenToYellow
lcCmtsMetric1GreenToYellow.description: Defines the green to yellow threshold for a particular metric.

lcCmtsMetric1YellowToRed.name: lcCmtsMetric1YellowToRed
lcCmtsMetric1YellowToRed.description: Defines the yellow to red threshold for a particular metric. A drop below this level will cause an ingress avoidance action if the metric is enabled.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileTable.description: Defines with profile in the Tranmission table will be used for ingress avoidance. The order from 1-3 is the desired order for profile use.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceProfileEntry.description: Defines with profile in the Tranmission table will be used for ingress avoidance. The order from 1-3 is the desired order for profile use.

lcCmtsProfileCarrierPathIndex.name: lcCmtsProfileCarrierPathIndex
lcCmtsProfileCarrierPathIndex.description: Carrier path index for the profile table.

lcCmtsStatus.name: lcCmtsStatus
lcCmtsStatus.description: Defines whether or not the particular profile is enabled for use in ingress avoidance.

lcCmtsTransmissionProfileIndex.name: lcCmtsTransmissionProfileIndex
lcCmtsTransmissionProfileIndex.description: Describes the index into the transmission profile table.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileTable.description: Defines Modulation Profile and Bandwidth. Coding Efficiency is calculated based on the entries.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceTxProfileEntry.description: Defines with profile in the Tranmission table will be used for ingress avoidance. The order from 1-3 is the desired order for profile use.

lcCmtsTxProfileIndex.name: lcCmtsTxProfileIndex
lcCmtsTxProfileIndex.description: Index for the transmission profile table.

lcCmtsModulationProfileIndex.name: lcCmtsModulationProfileIndex
lcCmtsModulationProfileIndex.description: Index into the MCNS Upstream Modulation Table.

lcCmtsBandwidth.name: lcCmtsBandwidth
lcCmtsBandwidth.description: Bandwidth to be used with the modulation profile selected.

lcCmtsCodingEfficiency.name: lcCmtsCodingEfficiency
lcCmtsCodingEfficiency.description: Coding efficiency is calculated based on the modulation profile and bandwidth selected. This number represents information bytes/second for the given settings. This calculation in based on short and long data grants and a min and max size packet transmitted for each type of grant.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigTable.description: Defines the aging multipliers and calculation timers for each metric.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceMetricConfigEntry.description: Defines the aging multipliers and calculation timers for each metric.

lcCmtsCalculationTimer.name: lcCmtsCalculationTimer
lcCmtsCalculationTimer.description: Frequency at which metrics should be calculated in milliseconds.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusTable.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusTable
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusTable.description: This table is a status table for all frequency ranges allowed per carrier path.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceFreqStatusEntry.description: This table is a status table for all frequency ranges allowed per carrier path.

lcCmtsFreqStatusFc.name: lcCmtsFreqStatusFc
lcCmtsFreqStatusFc.description: Denotes whether or not this is a center frequency.

lcCmtsFreqStatusAvailable.name: lcCmtsFreqStatusAvailable
lcCmtsFreqStatusAvailable.description: Denotes whether or not this is available. no - frequency is not available for ingress avoidance. yes - frequency is not being used and is available for ingress avoidance. inuse - frequency is actively being used by an upstream. reserved - frequency is reserved by an upstream channel which is currently down.

lcCmtsFreqStatusStatus.name: lcCmtsFreqStatusStatus
lcCmtsFreqStatusStatus.description: Denotes status of frequency. Large integers represents the channel is extremely bad. Zero/UNK represents a Good frequency to try.

lcCmtsFreqStatusTimeLastUsed.name: lcCmtsFreqStatusTimeLastUsed
lcCmtsFreqStatusTimeLastUsed.description: Denotes time since this frequency was last used.

lcCmtsFreqStatusUpTime.name: lcCmtsFreqStatusUpTime
lcCmtsFreqStatusUpTime.description: Denotes up time last time used or current up time on this frequency.

lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceHealthTabl.name: lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceHealthTable
lcCmtsUpstreamIngressAvoidanceHealthTabl.description: Displays the health of each upstream channel.

lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceHealthEntry.name: lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceHealthEntry
lcCmtsIngressAvoidanceHealthEntry.description: Displays the health of each upstream channel.

lcCmtsHealthFc.name: lcCmtsHealthFc
lcCmtsHealthFc.description: Center frequency for the upstream channel.

lcCmtsHealthUpTime.name: lcCmtsHealthUpTime
lcCmtsHealthUpTime.description: Time the channel has been up in this configuration.

lcCmtsMetric1Status.name: lcCmtsMetric1Status
lcCmtsMetric1Status.description: Current state of the upstream channel using the thresholds set in the threshold table.

lcCmtsMultiUsConfigTable.name: lcCmtsMultiUsConfigTable
lcCmtsMultiUsConfigTable.description: Defines carrier paths (Physical Connectivity) and channel groups for each upstream.

lcCmtsMultiUsConfigEntry.name: lcCmtsMultiUsConfigEntry
lcCmtsMultiUsConfigEntry.description: Defines carrier paths (Physical Connectivity) and channel groups for each upstream.

lcCmtsCarrierPath.name: lcCmtsCarrierPath
lcCmtsCarrierPath.description: Defines physical connectivity to each upstream receiver ifIndexes with the same carrier path cannot operate on the same frequencies.

lcCmtsChannelGroup.name: lcCmtsChannelGroup
lcCmtsChannelGroup.description: Defines which upstreams must operate on the same frequencies. Value of zero means that a given upstream is independant of all other upstream channels. Any upstream with the same value must operate on the same frequency.

lcCmtsFrontFanOn.name: lcCmtsFrontFanOn
lcCmtsFrontFanOn.description: Current on/off state of the CMTS fan closest to the front of the chassis. If the fan is on, true is returned. If the fan is off, false is returned.

lcCmtsMiddleFanOn.name: lcCmtsMiddleFanOn
lcCmtsMiddleFanOn.description: Current on/off state of the CMTS fan closest to the middle of the chassis. If the fan is on, true is returned. If the fan is off, false is returned.

lcCmtsBackFanOn.name: lcCmtsBackFanOn
lcCmtsBackFanOn.description: Current on/off state of the CMTS fan closest to the back of the chassis. If the fan is on, true is returned. If the fan is off, false is returned.

lcCmtsAnnex.name: lcCmtsAnnex
lcCmtsAnnex.description: FEC mode - Default is Annex B which is the North American Standard Annex A is used for Euro DOCSIS.

lcCmtsFrequencySplit.name: lcCmtsFrequencySplit
lcCmtsFrequencySplit.description: Upstream/Downstream Frequency Split. The standard North American split is 5-42/50-862 MHz. Euro DOCSIS Split is 5-65/100-862 MHz.

lcEvSyslog2.name: lcEvSyslog2
lcEvSyslog2.description: The IP address of a 2nd Syslog server. If 0.0.0.0, syslog transmission is inhibited.

lcEvSyslog3.name: lcEvSyslog3
lcEvSyslog3.description: The IP address of a 3rd Syslog server. If 0.0.0.0, syslog transmission is inhibited.

lcCpeMacToCmMacTable.name: lcCpeMacToCmMacTable
lcCpeMacToCmMacTable.description: This is a table to provide a mechanism for finding the MAC address of the CM to which a CPE device is connected. The table is indexed by the MAC address of the device whose associated CM is being sought. There is exactly one row in this table for each MAC address learned by the CMTS. It is possible to have entries in this table that have no associated CM MAC address and those entries are denoted by a CM MAC address of 00 00 00 00 00 00.

lcCpeMacToCmMacEntry.name: lcCpeMacToCmMacEntry
lcCpeMacToCmMacEntry.description: A row in the lcCpeMacToCmMacTable. An entry in this table exists for each MAC address that has been learned by the CMTS and is present in it Forwarding Database.

lcCpeMac.name: lcCpeMac
lcCpeMac.description: A MAC address in the CMTS Forwarding Database. This is the index into the lcCpeMacToCmMacTable.

lcCmMac.name: lcCmMac
lcCmMac.description: The MAC address of the CM to which the index MAC address is connected. For entries learned on the Ethernet side of the CMTS bridge this value will be 00 00 00 00 00 00 which indicates no CM associativity. For a CM MAC entry this value will be the same as the index, that is the MAC address of the CM itself. For a CPE device on the Cable side of the CMTS bridge this value will be the MAC address of the CM to which that CPE device is connected.

lcCmCountsTable.name: lcCmCountsTable
lcCmCountsTable.description: This is a table to provide the number of active and registered modems on each upstream and for the entire system. Active modems are those that have performed at least an initial ranging and have not yet been ranging-aborted, ranging-timedout, or de-registered. This table is populated from the Registrar CM entries functions.

lcCmCountsEntry.name: lcCmCountsEntry
lcCmCountsEntry.description: A row in the lcCmCountsTable. An entry in this table exists for each upstream channel on the CMTS (1-8) and for the system totals.

lcCmCountsRowNum.name: lcCmCountsRowNum
lcCmCountsRowNum.description: A row index into the lcCmCountsTable. Indices 1 through 8 correspond to upstream channels and index 9 corresponds to the system totals.

lcActiveCmCounts.name: lcActiveCmCounts
lcActiveCmCounts.description: The number of CMs on this channel that have performed an initial ranging and are still marked as operational by the CMTS.

lcRegisteredCmCounts.name: lcRegisteredCmCounts
lcRegisteredCmCounts.description: The number of CMs on this channel that are currently registered with the CMTS.

lcProvisioningControl.name: lcProvisioningControl
lcProvisioningControl.description: Controls the use of file-based provisioning by the CMTS. If set to: use-dhcp-and-tftp(1) the CMTS will use DHCP to find its IP address, subnet mask, default router, and TFTP server. Configuration parameters will be provisioned from a TFTP'ed parameter file, use-dhcp (2) DHCP will be used to find the IP address, subnet mask, and defaultrouter, but all other parameters will come from NVRAM, use-tftp (3) The CMTS will use NVRAM for its IP address, but other configured parameters will be loaded via TFTP, use-nvram (4) All operational parameters are taken from nonvolatile RAM.

lcConfigIpAddress.name: lcConfigIpAddress
lcConfigIpAddress.description: The IP address of the CMTS; provides a writable equivalent of ipAdEntAddr. If set to null (0.0.0.0), the address must be provided through DHCP.

lcConfigIpSubnet.name: lcConfigIpSubnet
lcConfigIpSubnet.description: The subnet mask corresponding to lcConfigIpAddress; provides a writable equivalent of ipAdEntNetMask.

lcConfigIpGateway.name: lcConfigIpGateway
lcConfigIpGateway.description: The Gateway address defines the next hop router (forwarder) destination for non-local IP packets.

lcConfigTftpAddress.name: lcConfigTftpAddress
lcConfigTftpAddress.description: The IP address of the TFTP Server supplying provisioning configuration data.

lcConfigTftpFilename.name: lcConfigTftpFilename
lcConfigTftpFilename.description: The default filename on the TFTP Server for acquiring provisioning configuration data (may be overridden by DHCP).

lcConfigTimeServerAddress.name: lcConfigTimeServerAddress
lcConfigTimeServerAddress.description: The IP address of the Time Server (RFC868) supplying provisioning time.

lcConfigTimeoffset.name: lcConfigTimeoffset
lcConfigTimeoffset.description: Time offset in seconds to apply to provisioned GMT time

lcConfigSNTPAddress.name: lcConfigSNTPAddress
lcConfigSNTPAddress.description: The IP Address of the SNTP Timer Server supplying provisioning time

lcSerialPortBaudRate.name: lcSerialPortBaudRate
lcSerialPortBaudRate.description: Baud rate configured on this Serial Port

lcSerialPortDataBits.name: lcSerialPortDataBits
lcSerialPortDataBits.description: Number of data bits configured on this Serial Port

lcSerialPortParity.name: lcSerialPortParity
lcSerialPortParity.description: Type of parity configured on this Serial Port

lcSerialPortStopBits.name: lcSerialPortStopBits
lcSerialPortStopBits.description: Number of stop bits configured on this Serial Port

lcSerialPortModemEnable.name: lcSerialPortModemEnable
lcSerialPortModemEnable.description: Enable the Serial Port to run with modem leads enabled

lcModemVendorTable.name: lcModemVendorTable
lcModemVendorTable.description: This table defines modems that are allowed to register with this CMTS. Modem vendors are identified by the OUI portion of the MAC address used by the modem for registration. In order to allow further differentiation based on particular models, the entire MAC address may be masked and used to screen registrations.

lcModemVendorEntry.name: lcModemVendorEntry
lcModemVendorEntry.description: This entry identifies a class of modems which are allowed to register with this CMTS.

lcModemVendorIndex.name: lcModemVendorIndex
lcModemVendorIndex.description: An arbitrary index defining an instance of this entry. Ordering is not meaningful.

lcModemVendorControl.name: lcModemVendorControl
lcModemVendorControl.description: This object controls the creation and deletion of rows in this table.

lcModemVendorMacAddress.name: lcModemVendorMacAddress
lcModemVendorMacAddress.description: When masked, identifies a group of modems that are allowed to register at this CMTS. Note that the LSB of the first octet is the multicast bit; since it cannot identify a modem, it is defined to be zero.

lcModemVendorMask.name: lcModemVendorMask
lcModemVendorMask.description: Applied to the MAC address to identify which modems are allowed to register at this CMTS. Ordinarily, the OUI portion is used to identify particular vendors, but arbitrary masks can be used. The LSB of the first octet is the multicast bit and is defined to be zero.

lcDPStatisticsInterval.name: lcDPStatisticsInterval
lcDPStatisticsInterval.description: Controls the interval at which data rates are calculated on the CMTS.

lcDPStatisticsTable.name: lcDPStatisticsTable
lcDPStatisticsTable.description: The table contains the last calculated statistics for data rates for each port on the CMTS.

lcDPStatisticsEntry.name: lcDPStatisticsEntry
lcDPStatisticsEntry.description: The Entry contains the last calculated statistics for data rates for one port on the CMTS.

lcDPStatisticsTxFrameRate.name: lcDPStatisticsTxFrameRate
lcDPStatisticsTxFrameRate.description: The last calculated frames per second transmitted on this port.

lcDPStatisticsRxFrameRate.name: lcDPStatisticsRxFrameRate
lcDPStatisticsRxFrameRate.description: The last calculated frames per second received on this port.

lcDPStatisticsTxOctetRate.name: lcDPStatisticsTxOctetRate
lcDPStatisticsTxOctetRate.description: The last calculated octets per second transmitted on this port.

lcDPStatisticsRxOctetRate.name: lcDPStatisticsRxOctetRate
lcDPStatisticsRxOctetRate.description: The last calculated octets per second received on this port.

lcForwardingMode.name: lcForwardingMode
lcForwardingMode.description: Controls the Forwarding Data Base Learning Mode. If set to none(1), the CMTS uses transparent learning. If set to dhcp-arp(2), the CMTS uses Layer-3 switching based on DHCP and ARP. Mode dhcp-arp(2) is not allowed if FunnelMode is enabled(2). The default is none(1).

lcProxyArp.name: lcProxyArp
lcProxyArp.description: Controls Proxy ARP on the CMTS when it is in transparent learning mode. If set to enable(1), the CMTS responds to an ARP received from the Cable when the IP Address is known and responds to an ARP received from the Ethernet when the IP Address in known to be on the Cable. If set to disable(2), CMTS does not respond to any ARPs. Proxy ARP cannot be enabled if FunnelMode is enabled(2). The default is disabled(2).

lcProxyArpTimeout.name: lcProxyArpTimeout
lcProxyArpTimeout.description: Controls the timeout (in seconds) of the Proxy Arp cache entries.

lcArpSpoofingProtection.name: lcArpSpoofingProtection
lcArpSpoofingProtection.description: Controls ARP Spoofing Protection on the CMTS when it is in layer-3 switching mode (Mode B). CMTS must be in MODE B for ARP Spoofing Protection to work. If set to enable(1), the CMTS will not forward or glean information from ARP packets received from the Cable interface whose sender's IP address does not match the IP address for the sender's hardware address as learned from DHCP gleaning. If set to disable(2), the CMTS will forward the ARP packet and will update its ARP cache with the IP address in the ARP.

lcFunnelMode.name: lcFunnelMode
lcFunnelMode.description: Controls whether or not the CMTS is in Funnel Mode. If set to enable(1), all upstream data packets are sent out the ethernet port. If set to disable(2), all packets are processed normally. Funnel mode is not allowed if ProxyArp is enabled(1) or ForwardingMode is not none(1). The default is disabled(2).

lcDeregCmAgeTime.name: lcDeregCmAgeTime
lcDeregCmAgeTime.description: The time-to-live of a CM entry in the FDB for a CM that has been de-registered. This interval is expressed as the number of seconds between de-registration and removal from the FDB. If the CM ranges during this time interval aging is cancelled. The default interval is 172800 seconds (48 hours).

lcRngNotRegCmAgeTime.name: lcRngNotRegCmAgeTime
lcRngNotRegCmAgeTime.description: The time-to-live of a CM entry in the FDB for a CM that has performed an initial ranging request but has not yet completed registration. This interval is expressed as the number of seconds between receipt of the initial ranging request and removal from the FDB. If the CM registers this time interval is cancelled. The default interval is 120 seconds.

lcUsedot1dTpAgingTime.name: lcUsedot1dTpAgingTime
lcUsedot1dTpAgingTime.description: This object determines whether the default time-to-live of an entry in the FDB as specified by the dot1dTpAgingTime object is to be used or not. This setting is only meaningful for FDB entries learned on the Cable interface when Mode B (DHCP-ARP) forwarding is enabled. If enabled in Mode B, then the DHCP lease time is NOT used to specify the aging time for entries, but rather the setting for dot1dTpAgingTime is used. This object has no effect in Mode A (transparent) bridging mode. The default is disable (do NOT use dot1dTpAgingTime).

lccmtsHwRevArbCPLD.name: lccmtsHwRevArbCPLD
lccmtsHwRevArbCPLD.description: The hardware revision number for the Arb CPLD chip.

lccmtsHwRevTxCPLD.name: lccmtsHwRevTxCPLD
lccmtsHwRevTxCPLD.description: The hardware revision number for the Tx CPLD chip.

lccmtsHwRevAFFPGA.name: lccmtsHwRevAFFPGA
lccmtsHwRevAFFPGA.description: The hardware revision number for the AFFPGA chip.

lccmtsHwRevGT64010.name: lccmtsHwRevGT64010
lccmtsHwRevGT64010.description: The hardware revision number for the Galileo GT-64010 chip.

lccmtsHwRevPLX9080.name: lccmtsHwRevPLX9080
lccmtsHwRevPLX9080.description: The hardware revision number for the PLX PCI 9080 chip.

lccmtsHwRevBCM3210.name: lccmtsHwRevBCM3210
lccmtsHwRevBCM3210.description: The hardware revision number for the Broadcom 3210 chip.

lccmtsHwRevBCM3033.name: lccmtsHwRevBCM3033
lccmtsHwRevBCM3033.description: The hardware revision number for the Broadcom 3033 chip.

lccmtsHwRevSunset.name: lccmtsHwRevSunset
lccmtsHwRevSunset.description: The hardware revision number for the Sunset transmitter.

lccmtsHwRevDEC21143.name: lccmtsHwRevDEC21143
lccmtsHwRevDEC21143.description: The hardware revision number for the DEC 21143 Ethernet chip.

lccmtsHwRevLXT970A.name: lccmtsHwRevLXT970A
lccmtsHwRevLXT970A.description: The hardware revision number for the LXT970 Ethernet PHY A chip.

lccmtsHwRevLXT970B.name: lccmtsHwRevLXT970B
lccmtsHwRevLXT970B.description: The hardware revision number for the LXT970 Ethernet PHY B chip.

lccmtsHwRevRfRxTable.name: lccmtsHwRevRfRxTable
lccmtsHwRevRfRxTable.description: The table contains hardware revision numbers for the chips of each upstream RF receiver channel in the CMTS.

lccmtsHwRevRfRxEntry.name: lccmtsHwRevRfRxEntry
lccmtsHwRevRfRxEntry.description: The table contains hardware revision numbers for the chips of one upstream RF receiver channel in the CMTS.

lccmtsHwRevBCM3137.name: lccmtsHwRevBCM3137
lccmtsHwRevBCM3137.description: The hardware revision number for this Broadcom 3033 chip.

lccmtsHwRevRipsaw.name: lccmtsHwRevRipsaw
lccmtsHwRevRipsaw.description: The hardware revision number for this Ripsaw receiver.

lccmtsUpPolice.name: lccmtsUpPolice
lccmtsUpPolice.description: The tolerance percentage to apply to configured maximum Upstream bit rate. This allows for minor differences in shaping algoithms by not policing to the edge. The default valued is 0% which will police to the edge.

lccmtsDnPolice.name: lccmtsDnPolice
lccmtsDnPolice.description: The tolerance percentage to apply to configured maximum Downstream bit rate. This allows for minor differences in shaping algoithms by not policing to the edge. The default valued is 0% which will police to the edge.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayControl.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayControl
lccmtsBOOTPRelayControl.description: Controls the operation of the CMTS BOOTP Relay function as listed. If set to: disabled(1) The CMTS will process BOOTP/DHCP packets without special relay processing (this is the boot-time default), enabled-relay-only(2) BOOTP/DHCP packets will be intercepted using the relay function described in RFC-1542, and server targets will be selected based not only on non-zero IP addresses in the server target table, but also based on whether the client is a registered CM, or unregistered and assumed to be a CPE host; That is, requests from CMs and CPE hosts may be sent to different servers, if desired. enabled-relay-tagging(3) BOOTP/DHCP packets will be tagged with Agent info containing the MAC address of the modem through which this request originated, in Remote ID format. enabled-cm-only-relay(4) BOOTP/DHCP packets will be intercepted using the relay function described in RFC-1542, and server targets will be selected based on non-zero IP addresses in the server target table for CM hosts ONLY. Requests from CPE hosts will be handled without special relay processing.

lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetTable.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetTable
lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetTable.description: The table contains BOOTP Server target addresses, and discrimination parameters for selective targeting based upon registered CM addresses.

lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetEntry.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetEntry
lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetEntry.description: Each entry contains one BOOTP Server target IP address, which can be unicast, multicast or broadcast, and, optionally, discrimination parameters for selective targeting based upon registered CM addresses.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayIndex.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayIndex
lccmtsBOOTPRelayIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies an entry in the lccmtsBOOTPRelayTable.

lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetIP.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetIP
lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetIP.description: The IP (uni/multi/broad)cast address of targeted BOOTP server(s). If row is notInService(2), this entry is ignored.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntSelectionMask.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntSelectionMask
lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntSelectionMask.description: Controls the selection of BOOTP Servers based upon client status. If set to: target-handles-CM-only(1) Client BOOTP/DHCP packets will be sent to this server address *ONLY* if client is a registered CM, target-handles-CPE-only(2) Client BOOTP/DHCP packets will be sent to this server address *ONLY* if client is NOT a registered CM, i.e presumed to be a CPE/host on the far side of a CM, target-handles-any(3) Any client (CM or CPE) BOOTP/DHCP request will be sent to this server address.

lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetHits.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetHits
lccmtsBOOTPRelaySvrTargetHits.description: Counts # times a client request was copied to this target, regardless of CM discrimintation.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayRowStatus.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayRowStatus
lccmtsBOOTPRelayRowStatus.description: Controls and reflects the status of rows in this table. Only notInService(2) and active(1) states are supported - default is notInService.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayBadLengthDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayBadLengthDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayBadLengthDiscards.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was silently dropped, due to having a miscalculated length value.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalOriginDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalOriginDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalOriginDiscards.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was silently dropped, due to originating in the CMTS (should never happen!).

lccmtsBOOTPRelayExcessiveHopsDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayExcessiveHopsDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayExcessiveHopsDiscards.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was silently dropped, due to an excessive hop count before increment.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayGatewayAddrCopies.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayGatewayAddrCopies
lccmtsBOOTPRelayGatewayAddrCopies.description: Counts # times an incoming packet had our (CMTS) address copied into the giaddr field.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalAddrSinks.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalAddrSinks
lccmtsBOOTPRelayLocalAddrSinks.description: Counts # times an incoming packet was selected for local processing, due to having a CMTS CHADDR.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongGatewayAddrDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongGatewayAddrDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongGatewayAddrDiscards.description: Counts # times an incoming packet was silently dropped, due to server inserting the wrong gateway addr (i.e. not ours).

lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoCopyBufDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoCopyBufDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoCopyBufDiscards.description: Counts # times a packet was silently dropped, due to lack of a malloc'd copy buffer.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayMiscSilentDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayMiscSilentDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayMiscSilentDiscards.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was silently dropped, due to a variety of reasons not specifically tracked.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoEpilBufDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoEpilBufDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayNoEpilBufDiscards.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was dropped, due to a lack of Epilogue UDP/IP buffers.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntDstPortDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntDstPortDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayClntDstPortDiscards.description: Counts # times an incoming packet was dropped, due to a destination port of BOOTP CLIENT.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawRequests.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawRequests
lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawRequests.description: Counts # times an incoming packet was processed as a raw request (subject to further filtering).

lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawReplies.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawReplies
lccmtsBOOTPRelayRawReplies.description: Counts # times an incoming packet was processed as a raw reply (subject to further filtering).

lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCM.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCM
lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCM.description: Counts # times an incoming request came from a modem.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCPE.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCPE
lccmtsBOOTPRelayRqstFromCPE.description: Counts # times an incoming request came from Customer Premises Equipment.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPCATVPuts.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPCATVPuts
lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPCATVPuts.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was sent to the cable DP_put routine.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPEnetPuts.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPEnetPuts
lccmtsBOOTPRelayDPEnetPuts.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was sent to the ethernet DP_put routine.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayEpilUDPBufSends.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayEpilUDPBufSends
lccmtsBOOTPRelayEpilUDPBufSends.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was sent to the Epilogue UDP_send routine.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayNullMACTags.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayNullMACTags
lccmtsBOOTPRelayNullMACTags.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was tagged with a null CM macaddress.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayNonNullMACTags.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayNonNullMACTags
lccmtsBOOTPRelayNonNullMACTags.description: Counts # times an outgoing packet was tagged with a non-null CM macaddress.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortRqstDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortRqstDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortRqstDiscards.description: Counts # times an incoming request packet was discarded due to originating on a port other than cable.

lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortReplyDiscards.name: lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortReplyDiscards
lccmtsBOOTPRelayWrongPortReplyDiscards.description: Counts # times an incoming reply packet was discarded due to originating on a port other than enet.

lccmtsDNSResolverControl.name: lccmtsDNSResolverControl
lccmtsDNSResolverControl.description: Controls the operation of the DNS Resolver function as listed. If set to: disabled(1) The CMTS will not resolve names into addresses using DNS, returning a blank record for all lookups, enabled(2) DNS reply packets will be processed and the results returned in the response record.

lccmtsDNSResolverServiceType.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServiceType
lccmtsDNSResolverServiceType.description: Kind of DNS resolution service provided: recursiveOnly(1) indicates a stub resolver. iterativeOnly(2) indicates a normal full service resolver. recursiveAndIterative(3) indicates a full-service resolver which performs a mix of recursive and iterative queries.

lccmtsDNSResolverServersCfgd.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServersCfgd
lccmtsDNSResolverServersCfgd.description: The numbers indicates the total number of enabled servers configured by the operator.

lccmtsDNSResolverServerTable.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServerTable
lccmtsDNSResolverServerTable.description: This table contains DNS Server addresses, and hierarchical selection parameters for Name Server lookups.

lccmtsDNSResolverServerEntry.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServerEntry
lccmtsDNSResolverServerEntry.description: Each entry contains one DNS Server target IP address, its dot notation name, and its status (active or notInService).

lccmtsDNSResolverIndex.name: lccmtsDNSResolverIndex
lccmtsDNSResolverIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies an entry in the lccmtsDNSResolverTable.

lccmtsDNSResolverServerIP.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServerIP
lccmtsDNSResolverServerIP.description: The IP address of a DNS server. If row status is notInService(2), this entry is ignored.

lccmtsDNSResolverServerPriority.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServerPriority
lccmtsDNSResolverServerPriority.description: Precedence (priority) ordering of this entry in the server lookup hierarchy. Highest legal number is highest priority, lowest number is lowest priority.

lccmtsDNSResolverServerName.name: lccmtsDNSResolverServerName
lccmtsDNSResolverServerName.description: The dot notation name of the DNS server.

lccmtsDNSResolverRowStatus.name: lccmtsDNSResolverRowStatus
lccmtsDNSResolverRowStatus.description: Controls and reflects the status of rows in this table. Only notInService(2) and active(1) states are supported - default is notInService.

lccmtsDevServerBootState.name: lccmtsDevServerBootState
lccmtsDevServerBootState.description: If operational(1), the device has completed loading and processing of configuration parameters and the CMTS has completed the Registration exchange. If disabled(2) then the device was administratively disabled, possibly by being refused network access in the configuration file. If waitingForDhcpOffer(3) then a DHCP Discover has been transmitted and no offer has yet been received. If waitingForDhcpResponse(4) then a DHCP Request has been transmitted and no response has yet been received. If waitingForTimeServer(5) then a Time Request has been transmitted and no response has yet been received. If waitingForTftp(6) then a request to the TFTP parameter server has been made and no response received. If refusedByCmts(7) then the Registration Request/Response exchange with the CMTS failed. If forwardingDenied(8) then the registration process completed, but the network access option in the received configuration file prohibits forwarding.

lccmtsDevServerDhcp.name: lccmtsDevServerDhcp
lccmtsDevServerDhcp.description: The IP address of the DHCP server that assigned an IP address to this device. Returns 0.0.0.0 if DHCP was not used for IP address assignment.

lccmtsDevServerTime.name: lccmtsDevServerTime
lccmtsDevServerTime.description: The IP address of the Time server (RFC-868).

lccmtsDevServerTftp.name: lccmtsDevServerTftp
lccmtsDevServerTftp.description: The IP address of the TFTP server responsible for downloading provisioning and configuration parameters to this device.

lccmtsDevServerConfigFile.name: lccmtsDevServerConfigFile
lccmtsDevServerConfigFile.description: The name of the device configuration file read from the TFTP server.

lcScanningFrequencyTable.name: lcScanningFrequencyTable
lcScanningFrequencyTable.description: Defines the frequencies and scanning order used by the modem to find the downstream channel.

lcScanningFrequencyEntry.name: lcScanningFrequencyEntry
lcScanningFrequencyEntry.description: Defines a range of channels to be used by the modem to find the downstream channel.

lcScanControl.name: lcScanControl
lcScanControl.description: Controls the creation and deletion of rows in this table. See RFC-1903 for definition of enumeration.

lcScanIndex.name: lcScanIndex
lcScanIndex.description: An ad-hoc index for defining the scanning order for this table.

lcScanFreqStart.name: lcScanFreqStart
lcScanFreqStart.description: The center frequency of the first channel to scan in this range.

lcScanFreqEnd.name: lcScanFreqEnd
lcScanFreqEnd.description: The center frequency of the last channel to scan in this range. This may be higher or lower than lcScanFreqStart.

lcScanUseHrc.name: lcScanUseHrc
lcScanUseHrc.description: If TRUE then the range is to use the HRC channels which correspond to the Std/IRC channels whose center frequencies are defined by FreqStart and FreqEnd (i.e. offset the values in FreqStart and FreqEnd before using them).

lcScanStep.name: lcScanStep
lcScanStep.description: The absolute value of the increment (or decrement) to use in stepping through this range.

lcScanChannelWidth.name: lcScanChannelWidth
lcScanChannelWidth.description: The channel width to use for this range. Only 6000 and 8000 are allowed.

lccmIpAddress.name: lccmIpAddress
lccmIpAddress.description: The IP address of the CM; provides a writable equivalent of ipAdEntAddr. If set to null (0.0.0.0), the address must be provided through DHCP.

lccmIpSubnet.name: lccmIpSubnet
lccmIpSubnet.description: The subnet mask corresponding to lcCMIpAddress; provides a writable equivalent of ipAdEntNetMask.

lcTrapTypeTable.name: lcTrapTypeTable
lcTrapTypeTable.description: The trap type control table contains an entry for each type of trap supported by the system.

lcTrapTypeEntry.name: lcTrapTypeEntry
lcTrapTypeEntry.description: An entry in this table defines a particular trap type supported by the system.

lcTrapTypeIndex.name: lcTrapTypeIndex
lcTrapTypeIndex.description: The variable is the index of this entry in the lcTrapTypeTable.

lcTrapTypeStatus.name: lcTrapTypeStatus
lcTrapTypeStatus.description: This variable controls whether this type of trap is generated by this device.

lcBootedAlbumFilename.name: lcBootedAlbumFilename
lcBootedAlbumFilename.description: The filename that is embedded in the flash album header of the currently booted album software image

lcBootedAlbumSequenceNumber.name: lcBootedAlbumSequenceNumber
lcBootedAlbumSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the currently loaded software image.

lcIpFiltSendDu.name: lcIpFiltSendDu
lcIpFiltSendDu.description: This variable specifies whether a 'destination unreachable' ICMP message is sent when a packet is filtered due to IP protocol filtering.

lcIpFiltIcmp9.name: lcIpFiltIcmp9
lcIpFiltIcmp9.description: This variable specifies whether ICMP Type 9 packets are forwarded or filtered on all interfaces.

lcMcastControl.name: lcMcastControl
lcMcastControl.description: Action to take on receiving an IP multicast packet bound for the subscriber network. If pass(1), the CM acts as a bridge, transparently forwarding all multicast packets. If filter(2), all IP multicast packets are discarded. If igmp(3) then the CM acts as an IGMP proxy and only forwards packets whose addresses were requested by the subscriber. If trap(4) then the CM transmits IGMP queries on the subscriber side. On receiving Reports, it transmits an SNMP trap. Multicast packets are forwarded, and presumably blocked by SNMP- managed filters.

lcMcastAddressTable.name: lcMcastAddressTable
lcMcastAddressTable.description: Describes the current state of multicast address filtering being performed by the IGMP proxy.

lcMcastAddressEntry.name: lcMcastAddressEntry
lcMcastAddressEntry.description: Describes the current state of a multicast address controlled by the IGMP proxy.

lcMcastAddress.name: lcMcastAddress
lcMcastAddress.description: The IP multicast address being managed.

lcMcastAdminState.name: lcMcastAdminState
lcMcastAdminState.description: Controls addition of static entries or deletion of any entries in this table.

lcMcastOperState.name: lcMcastOperState
lcMcastOperState.description: Reflects the IGMP state of this address. If static(4), the entry was created as a result of management action, and the entry is not subject to the IGMP protocol.

lcMcastTtl.name: lcMcastTtl
lcMcastTtl.description: Time-to-live for this entry. Will return zero for static entries.

lcMcastTrapAddress.name: lcMcastTrapAddress
lcMcastTrapAddress.description: The IP multicast address that is included in the lcMcastJoin trap. This object only exists for purposes of inclusion in the trap message.

lcRestartFromFactoryDefaults.name: lcRestartFromFactoryDefaults
lcRestartFromFactoryDefaults.description: Setting this object to true(1) causes the device to reset. When restarting, it will have forgotten all configuration parameters that are normally stored in nonvolatile memory. The device will start up as if delivered from the factory. Reading this object always returns false(2).

lcPhyTable.name: lcPhyTable
lcPhyTable.description: Determines how the ETHERNET PHYs are configured and operating

lcPhyEntry.name: lcPhyEntry
lcPhyEntry.description: Determines how an ETHERNET PHYs is configured and operating

lcPhyEnable.name: lcPhyEnable
lcPhyEnable.description: If true, this PHY may be used. If false, this will not be used.

lcPhyAutoNegotiate.name: lcPhyAutoNegotiate
lcPhyAutoNegotiate.description: If true, this PHY autonegotiates if active. If false, this PHY is manually configured if active.

lcPhyActive.name: lcPhyActive
lcPhyActive.description: If true, this PHY is the one being used. If false, this PHY is not being used.

lcPhySpeed.name: lcPhySpeed
lcPhySpeed.description: Determines the speed for this PHY. If lcPhyAutoNegotiate is true, writes to this value are prohibited. If lcPhyAutoNegotiate is false, this PHY will be force to this speed. Valid values are 10000000 and 100000000

lcPhyFullDuplex.name: lcPhyFullDuplex
lcPhyFullDuplex.description: Determines the duplex mode for this PHY. If lcPhyAutoNegotiate is true, writes to this value are prohibited. If lcPhyAutoNegotiate is false, this PHY will be force to this duplex mode

lcStickyYellowTable.name: lcStickyYellowTable
lcStickyYellowTable.description: This table provides a maintenance-history area where notes about the device may be stored. The contents of this table are entirely for human benefit and have no effect on the operation of the device. Up to 8 entries of up to 80 characters each may be stored.

lcStickyYellowEntry.name: lcStickyYellowEntry
lcStickyYellowEntry.description: Each entry provides a line of text of maintenance history.

lcStickyYellowIndex.name: lcStickyYellowIndex
lcStickyYellowIndex.description: Provides an index by which to distinguish up to 8 lines of text.

lcStickyYellowPad.name: lcStickyYellowPad
lcStickyYellowPad.description: Contents of this object are for the benefit of a human operator and may be used for any information, such as maintenance history, that the operator wishes to associate with the device. Contents of this object have no effect on the operation of the device. Setting this object to any non-null value either creates the row or overwrites previous text. Setting to the the null string deletes the row. Set's longer than 80 characters are truncated.

lcResetFilters.name: lcResetFilters
lcResetFilters.description: Setting this object to true(1) causes the device to reset the following Docsis MIB objects as follows, so that filters are no longer applied to traffic: docsDevFilterLLCDefault is set to accept(2). docsDevFilterIpDefault is set to accept(2). All entries in the docsDevFilterLLCTable are destroyed. All entries in the docsDevFilterIpTable are destroyed. Note that the device is not reset; filters are destroyed on the fly. Reading this object always returns false(2). This object can be used to clear out previously set filters without having to know all the instances of existing entries.

lcResetNmAccessTable.name: lcResetNmAccessTable
lcResetNmAccessTable.description: Setting this object to true(1) causes the device to destroy all docsDevNmAccessTable entries, such that the table is empty. The DOCSIS Cable Device MIB specifies that it the table is empty, access to SNMP objects is unrestricted. Note that the device is not reset; entries are destroyed on the fly. Reading this object always returns false(2). This object can be used to clear out previously set entries in the docsDevNmAccessTable without having to know all the instances of existing entries.

lcFlashPersistenceSwitch.name: lcFlashPersistenceSwitch
lcFlashPersistenceSwitch.description: Specifies the flash persistence behavior of the associated MIB objects. lcFlashPersistenceSwitch MIB object is itself saved to flash. At modem startup, the value of lcFlashPersistenceSwitch is read from flash and used to determine how to initialize the associated MIB objects. At runtime, lcFlashPersistenceSwitch is used to determine whether or not modifications made to the enumerated MIB objects are saved to flash. The factory default is no bits set; thus, none of the enumerated MIB objects are initialized from flash, and subsequent modifications to the enumerated MIB objects are not saved to flash. If a bit value is set at startup, the associated MIB object will be initialized from flash memory, and subsequent modifications will be saved to flash. If a bit is set at runtime, the associated MIB object is immediately written to flash, and subsequent modifications will be saved to flash. If a bit value is not set at startup, factory default values will be used to initialize the associated MIB object, and subsequent modifications will not be saved to flash memory. If a bit is cleared during runtime, subsequent modifications to the associated MIB object will not be saved to flash. The nmAccess(0) bit effects the docsDevNmAccessTable. The llcIpFilters(1) bit effects docsDevFilterLLCDefault, docsDevFilterLLCTable, docsDevFilterIpDefault, and docsDevFilterIpTable.

lcConcatenationEnabled.name: lcConcatenationEnabled
lcConcatenationEnabled.description: For modem, this determines if concatenation should be turned on or not, when it is supported by the headend. For headend, this determines if concatenation support is desirable and possible (only possible on 3210B or later chips).

lcConsoleUserTable.name: lcConsoleUserTable
lcConsoleUserTable.description: Defines user names, passwords, and access privileges for console and telnet access to the device. This table is primarily a repository for user names and passwords, as the accesss rights are actually defined in other tables. This table points to the lcConsoleLevelTable, which in turn may point to docsDevNmAccessTable. Access to this table itself is restricted in the same manner as docsDevNmAccessTable; that is, the operator must have write privileges to be able to read this table (with exception of being able to read their own entry).

lcConsoleUserEntry.name: lcConsoleUserEntry
lcConsoleUserEntry.description: Describes the attributes of a single user login.

lcConsoleUserIndex.name: lcConsoleUserIndex
lcConsoleUserIndex.description: Provides an index to this table. Provides no semantics.

lcConsoleUserStatus.name: lcConsoleUserStatus
lcConsoleUserStatus.description: Controls additions and deletions from this table. May only be set to createAndGo or destroy.

lcConsoleUserName.name: lcConsoleUserName
lcConsoleUserName.description: User login name, as used for the console or telnet. Deletion of the currently logged in account results in being logged out.

lcConsoleUserPassword.name: lcConsoleUserPassword
lcConsoleUserPassword.description: The user's password, as used for the console or telnet. This is an MD5 hashed string, and returns a 32 character ASCII representation of the hex 16 byte value when a get is attempted. For set operations, the value for the set must be the 32 byte ASCII representation of the 16 byte hex MD5 hash value. See RFC 1321 for MD5 hash operations. The default value is the MD5 hash of the null string.

lcConsoleUserLevel.name: lcConsoleUserLevel
lcConsoleUserLevel.description: The index of a row in lcConsoleLevelTable which defines the access privileges for this user. If the referenced row does not exist then access is not allowed.

lcConsoleLevelTable.name: lcConsoleLevelTable
lcConsoleLevelTable.description: Defines access privilege levels for the console and for telnet. Entries in this table are referenced by the lcConsoleUserTable. This table, in turn, will reference docsDevNmAccessTable.

lcConsoleLevelEntry.name: lcConsoleLevelEntry
lcConsoleLevelEntry.description: Defines a specific console privilege level in terms of access method and access name.

lcConsoleLevelIndex.name: lcConsoleLevelIndex
lcConsoleLevelIndex.description: Provides an index to this table, referenced by lcConsoleUserLevel. Provides no ordering or other semantics.

lcConsoleLevelStatus.name: lcConsoleLevelStatus
lcConsoleLevelStatus.description: Controls additions and deletions from this table. May only be set to createAndGo or destroy.

lcConsoleLevelName.name: lcConsoleLevelName
lcConsoleLevelName.description: A label which can be attached to this access Level as a mnemonic aid. Not used operationally.

lcConsoleLevelMethod.name: lcConsoleLevelMethod
lcConsoleLevelMethod.description: Defines which SNMP access method is used to validate requests from this level. If snmpv1(1), then read-only, read-write, and sundry other privileges are derived from docsDevNmAccessTable and lcNmAccessExtensionTable.

lcConsoleLevelSecurityName.name: lcConsoleLevelSecurityName
lcConsoleLevelSecurityName.description: If snmpv1 access is used, this value supplies the community string.

lcNmAccessExtensionTable.name: lcNmAccessExtensionTable
lcNmAccessExtensionTable.description: Further qualifies the privileges accorded to each row of the docsDevNmAccessTable. This table provides a set of specific privileges for users who are either using SNMPv1 directly or who are using SNMPv1-based access through the console.

lcNmAccessExtensionEntry.name: lcNmAccessExtensionEntry
lcNmAccessExtensionEntry.description: Qualifies the privileges accorded to a row of docsDevNmAccessTable.

lcNmAccessAdditionalPrivileges.name: lcNmAccessAdditionalPrivileges
lcNmAccessAdditionalPrivileges.description: Defines additional privileges allowed a user. The resetAllowed bit (value 0x80) allows an operator with a read-only account the privilege of resetting the CMTS from either a telnet or console session using the CLI reset command, in addition to all other privileges allowed by the docsDevNmAccessTable for a read/only account. The resetAllowed bit does not allow the user to use the 'factory' option of the reset command. The resetAllowed bit does not allow the user remote SNMP write access to either the docsDevResetNow or the lcRestartFromFactoryDefault MIBs. A read/write entry gets reset ability automatically, so setting resetAllowed for read/write entries is not necessary. The accountManager bit (value 0x40) allows a read/write account to perform the additional account management function of creation, modification, and deletion of accounts, in addition to any other privileges accorded by docsDevNmAccessTable. Read/only accounts do not access the accountManager bit.

lcTelnetAllowedSessions.name: lcTelnetAllowedSessions
lcTelnetAllowedSessions.description: Indicates the number of remote telnet access sessions allowed. A value of 0 indicates remote telnet access is denied. A maximum of 5 is allowed.

lcSessionInactivityTimeout.name: lcSessionInactivityTimeout
lcSessionInactivityTimeout.description: The session inactivity timeout value in minutes. A value of 0 indicates no session timeout. The maximum timeout is one week. Applies to all sessions (both Command line and Telnet sessions), but each session maintains a separate inactivity timer. This timer starts after a successful login, and is restarted every time a command is entered. If this timer expires, the associated session is terminated. Termination of the console results in a user logout. Termination of a telnet session results in a user logout and a telnet disconnect process.

lcAuthFailErrorStatus.name: lcAuthFailErrorStatus
lcAuthFailErrorStatus.description: The reason for failure to validate the SNMP request. nmAccessTableRestriction(1) indicates that the requesting network management station (NMS) does not have appropriate permission to perform the SNMP request, because it either does not match an ip address in the docsDevNmAccessTable, or the community string in the SNMP request did not match the community string in docsDevNmAccessTable for the requesting NMS, or the docsDevNmAccessControl value specified in the docsDevNmAccessTable for this NMS was not sufficient to allow access for the SNMP request type (either 'get' or 'set'), or finally the SNMP request from this NMS is not accepted on the interface (ethernet or CATV) that the request was received. noWriteAccessToMibVar(2) indicates that an SNMP set request was received for a mib variable whose write access control is set. other(3) indicates an nonspecific error.
